keyMoments.title: Zoro Attempts to Leave Kuraigana Island
keyMoments.description: Zoro asks Mihawk for news about Luffy and requests a way to leave the island. Mihawk provides him with a small boat.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's loyalty to his captain and sets up his confrontation with the humandrills.

keyMoments.title: Zoro Confronts the Humandrills
keyMoments.description: While attempting to leave, Zoro battles humandrills who have learned to copy his Three Sword Style technique.
keyMoments.significance: First encounter with creatures that can mimic his own fighting style, presenting a unique challenge.
keyMoments.quote: They've copied my own sword style... Three Sword Style!

keyMoments.title: Zoro Refuses to Return to the Castle
keyMoments.description: Despite Mihawk's suggestion to rest at the castle, Zoro stubbornly continues fighting the humandrills.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's pride and determination, foreshadowing his eventual request to train under Mihawk.

relationships.description: Zoro seeks to leave Mihawk's island to reunite with Luffy. Mihawk provides assistance but also observes Zoro's struggle with the humandrills.

evolutionMoments.description: Mihawk provides Zoro with a boat and explains the history of the humandrills, showing a mentoring side.

name.japanese: ジュラキュール・ミホーク

keyMoments.title: Mihawk Comforts Perona About Moria
keyMoments.description: Mihawk tries to reassure Perona that news reports of Gecko Moria's death may be false, noting that Moria was alive when he left Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Shows a softer, more compassionate side of Mihawk.
keyMoments.quote: Moria's death may not be for real. When I left the Summit War of Marineford, Moria was still alive.

keyMoments.title: Mihawk Explains the Humandrills' Origins
keyMoments.description: Mihawk reveals the history of Kuraigana Island and how the humandrills learned to fight by observing a war in the former Shikkearu Kingdom.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial backstory about the island and demonstrates Mihawk's knowledge of its history.
keyMoments.quote: The humandrills learned their violent behavior by observing humans. The Shikkearu Kingdom had a big war a few years before I moved in, from which the humandrills learned how to fight and use weapons.

relationships.description: Mihawk shows concern for Perona's emotional state regarding news of Moria's death, attempting to comfort her.

evolutionMoments.description: Mihawk comforts Perona about Moria's reported death, showing unexpected compassion.

reveals.information: Mihawk moved to Kuraigana Island after the Shikkearu Kingdom fell and had a major war

keyMoments.title: Perona Learns of Moria's Reported Death
keyMoments.description: Perona cries upon receiving news reports of Gecko Moria's death at Marineford, showing her deep emotional connection to him.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals that Perona views Moria as a father figure and cares deeply about his wellbeing.

relationships.description: Perona views Moria as a father figure and is devastated by news of his reported death.

evolutionMoments.description: Perona's crying over Moria's reported death reveals the depth of her attachment to him.

reveals.information: Perona deeply cares for Gecko Moria and views him as a father figure

keyMoments.title: Brook's Peace Attempt on Nakamura Island
keyMoments.description: Brook tries to make peace between the Longarm Tribe and local cultists through music and speeches about non-violence.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Brook's pacifist nature and musical talents.

keyMoments.title: Brook Captured by Longarm Tribe
keyMoments.description: Despite his peaceful intentions, Brook is tied up and kidnapped by members of the Longarm Tribe.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Brook's storyline during the timeskip where he becomes a famous rock star with these same longarms as his managers.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Decides to Return to Marineford
keyMoments.description: Luffy accepts Rayleigh's guidance and decides to return to Marineford, the place where Ace died, while expressing his desire to reunite with his crew.
keyMoments.significance: A pivotal decision that leads to the famous 3D2Y message and the two-year timeskip. Shows Luffy's maturity in accepting guidance while dealing with grief.
keyMoments.quote: I want to meet my crew. I want to go back to Marineford.

relationships.description: Luffy listens to Rayleigh's counsel and accepts his suggestion to return to Marineford as part of a larger plan.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy shows trust in Rayleigh by agreeing to his plan to return to Marineford.

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Guides Luffy's Decision
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh suggests that Luffy return to Marineford, guiding the young pirate through his grief and toward a strategic plan.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Rayleigh's role as a mentor and strategist, helping Luffy navigate the aftermath of Ace's death.

keyMoments.title: Sancrin Captures Brook
keyMoments.description: Sancrin and other Longarm Tribe members kidnap Brook to display him as the world's only moving skeleton.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of Sancrin, who will later become one of Brook's managers during his time as Soul King.

relationships.description: Sancrin kidnaps Brook to exploit him as a curiosity. This relationship will later evolve into a professional partnership.

evolutionMoments.description: Sancrin and the Longarm Tribe capture Brook despite his peaceful intentions.

reveals.information: Member of the Longarm Tribe who captures Brook
